text: The images being developer assets but also marketer assets is an interesting problem! We will continue to think about this.

Thanks <@U6W3H6YN8> Its also interesting for me because I am primarily a designer, so I am creating the assets, designing and developing the pages, but sometimes handing them off to marketers to run campaigns with.

Makes sense (sounds like a cool job btw :smile_cat:). Generally, the marketer owned/used assets will live on in the File Manager, but we are looking into what it looks like for developer only assets to be able to be colocated. Lots of improvements we can make in both scenarios here, from the developer/designer experience perspective.

Thanks <@U54TVT3C1> I've been using cyberduck for a long time out of habit (and free) but I am tired of having a million cyberduck and finder windows open in addition to my browser and IDE. Trying to find a more automated solution. I tried Yummy yesterday and it works ok, but what I really want is something like gulp watch that runs immediately upon  detecting a change.
